layer.name: Sacrifice
layer.definition: Using what has been given to you for the purpose for which it was given — to benefit others, freely and without expectation of return. Costs you everything with a GUARANTEE of no return (to you). The return goes to others.

questions.text: I regularly give significant time to serve others — not just leftover time, but prime time that costs me something.
I use my execution skill and productivity to help others accomplish their goals, not just my own.
I help people with practical tasks — moving, building, fixing, organizing — even when I have plenty of my own work to do.
I show up for others' important events and moments even when it's inconvenient — weddings, funerals, crises, celebrations.
I give away my margin — the extra capacity I've built — rather than hoarding it for more personal productivity.
questions.principle: Margin is for giving, not hoarding
